get.description: Search and filter all news articles available via the Perigon API. The result includes a list of individual articles that were matched to your specific criteria.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search query, each article will be scored and ranked against it. Articles are searched on the title, description, and content fields. More ➜

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Search article headlines/title field. Semantic similar to q parameter.

schema.default: tesla OR TSLA OR "General Motors" OR GM

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: Search query on the description field. Semantic similar to q parameter.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Search query on the article's body of content field. Semantic similar to q parameter.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Search query on the url field. Semantic similar to q parameter. E.g. could be used for querying certain website sections, e.g. source=cnn.com&url=travel.

parameters.name: articleId
parameters.description: Article ID will search for a news article by the ID of the article. If several parameters are passed, all matched articles will be returned.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: Search for related content using a cluster ID. Passing a cluster ID will filter results to only the content found within the cluster.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: 'from' filter, will search articles published after the specified date, the date could be passed as ISO or 'yyyy-mm-dd'. Add time in ISO format, ie. 2023-03-01T00:00:00

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: 'to' filter, will search articles published before the specified date, the date could be passed as ISO or 'yyyy-mm-dd'. Add time in ISO format, ie. 2022-02-01T23:59:59

parameters.name: addDateFrom
parameters.description: 'addDateFrom' filter, will search articles added after the specified date, the date could be passed as ISO or 'yyyy-mm-dd'. Add time in ISO format, ie. 2022-02-01T00:00:00

parameters.name: addDateTo
parameters.description: 'addDateTo' filter, will search articles added before the specified date, the date could be passed as ISO or 'yyyy-mm-dd'. Add time in ISO format, ie. 2022-02-01T23:59:59

parameters.name: refreshDateFrom
parameters.description: Will search articles that were refreshed after the specified date. The date could be passed as ISO or 'yyyy-mm-dd'.  Add time in ISO format, ie. 2022-02-01T00:00:00

parameters.name: refreshDateTo
parameters.description: Will search articles that were refreshed before the specified date. The date could be passed as ISO or 'yyyy-mm-dd'. Add time in ISO format, ie. 2022-02-01T23:59:59

parameters.name: medium
parameters.description: Medium will filter out news articles medium, which could be 'Video' or 'Article'. If several parameters are passed, all matched articles will be returned.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Publisher's domain can include a subdomain. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. Wildcards (\* and ?) are suported (e.g. \*.cnn.com). More ➜

parameters.name: sourceGroup
parameters.description: One of the supported source groups. Find Source Groups in the guided part of our documentation... More ➜

parameters.name: excludeSource
parameters.description: The domain of the website, which should be excluded from the search. Multiple parameters could be provided. Wildcards (\* and ?) are suported (e.g. \*.cnn.com).

parameters.name: paywall
parameters.description: Filter to show only results where the source has a paywall (true) or does not have a paywall (false).

parameters.name: byline
parameters.description: Author names to filter by. Article author bylines are used as a source field. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: journalistId
parameters.description: Filter by journalist ID. Journalist IDs are unique journalist identifiers which can be found through the Journalist API, or in the matchedAuthors field. More ➜

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language code to filter by language. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. More ➜

parameters.name: searchTranslation
parameters.description: Expand a query to search the translation, translatedTitle, and translatedDescription fields for non-English articles.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Labels to filter by, could be 'Opinion', 'Paid-news', 'Non-news', etc. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. More ➜

parameters.name: excludeLabel
parameters.description: Exclude results that include specific labels (Opinion, Non-news, Paid News, etc.). You can filter multiple by repeating the parameter.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by categories. Categories are general themes that the article is about. Examples of categories: Tech, Politics, etc. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. Use 'none' to search uncategorized articles. More ➜

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: Filter by topics. Each topic is some kind of entity that the article is about. Examples of topics: Markets, Joe Biden, Green Energy, Climate Change, Cryptocurrency, etc. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. More ➜

parameters.name: excludeTopic
parameters.description: Filter by excluding topics. Each topic is some kind of entity that the article is about. Examples of topics: Markets, Joe Biden, Green Energy, Climate Change, Cryptocurrency, etc. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. More ➜

parameters.name: linkTo
parameters.description: Returns only articles that point to specified links (as determined by the 'links' field in the article response).

parameters.name: showReprints
parameters.description: Whether to return reprints in the response or not. Reprints are usually wired articles from sources like AP or Reuters that are reprinted in multiple sources at the same time. By default, this parameter is 'true'.

parameters.name: reprintGroupId
parameters.description: Shows all articles belonging to the same reprint group. A reprint group includes one original article (the first one processed by the API) and all its known reprints.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Filters articles where a specified city plays a central role in the content, beyond mere mentions, to ensure the results are deeply relevant to the urban area in question. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: Filters articles where a specified area, such as a neighborhood, borough, or district, plays a central role in the content, beyond mere mentions, to ensure the results are deeply relevant to the area in question. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filters articles where a specified state plays a central role in the content, beyond mere mentions, to ensure the results are deeply relevant to the state in question. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: locationsCountry
parameters.description: Filters articles where a specified country plays a central role in the content, beyond mere mentions, to ensure the results are deeply relevant to the country in question. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: excludeLocationsCountry
parameters.description: Excludes articles where a specified country plays a central role in the content, ensuring results are not deeply relevant to the country in question. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as AND operations, excluding articles relevant to any of the specified countries.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Return all articles that have the specified location. Location attributes are delimited by ':' between key and value, and '::' between attributes. Example: 'city:New York::state:NY'.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of the center point to search places

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude of the center point to search places

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: Maximum distance (in km) from starting point to search articles by tagged places

parameters.name: sourceCity
parameters.description: Find articles published by sources that are located within a given city.

parameters.name: sourceCounty
parameters.description: Find articles published by sources that are located within a given county.

parameters.name: sourceCountry
parameters.description: Find articles published by sources that are located within a given country.  Must be 2 character country code  (i.e. us, gb, etc).

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Country code to filter by country. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: sourceState
parameters.description: Find articles published by sources that are located within a given state.

parameters.name: sourceLon
parameters.description: Latitude of the center point to search articles created by local publications.

parameters.name: sourceLat
parameters.description: Latitude of the center point to search articles created by local publications.

parameters.name: sourceMaxDistance
parameters.description: Maximum distance from starting point to search articles created by local publications.

parameters.name: personWikidataId
parameters.description: List of person Wikidata IDs for filtering.

parameters.name: personName
parameters.description: List of person names for exact matches. Boolean and complex logic is not supported on this paramter.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: List of company IDs to filter by.

parameters.name: companyName
parameters.description: Search by company name.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: Search by company domains for filtering. E.g. companyDomain=apple.com.

parameters.name: companySymbol
parameters.description: Search by company symbols.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page number. From 0 to 10000. See the Pagination section for limitations.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of articles returned per page, from 0 to 100.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: 'relevance' to sort by relevance to the query, 'date' to sort by the publication date (desc), 'pubDate' is a synonym to 'date', 'addDate' to sort by 'addDate' field (desc), 'refreshDate' to sort by 'refreshDate' field (desc).

parameters.name: showNumResults
parameters.description: Whether to show the total number of all matched articles. Default value is false which makes queries a bit more efficient but also counts up to 10000 articles.

parameters.name: positiveSentimentFrom
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score greater than or equal to the specified value, indicating positive sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: positiveSentimentTo
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score less than or equal to the specified value, indicating positive sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: neutralSentimentFrom
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score greater than or equal to the specified value, indicating neutral sentiment. Explanation of sentimental values can be found in Docs under the Article Data section.

parameters.name: neutralSentimentTo
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score less than or equal to the specified value, indicating neutral sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: negativeSentimentFrom
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score greater than or equal to the specified value, indicating negative sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: negativeSentimentTo
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score less than or equal to the specified value, indicating negative sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: taxonomy
parameters.description: Filters by Google Content Categories. This field will accept 1 or more categories, must pass the full name of the category. Example: taxonomy=/Finance/Banking/Other, /Finance/Investing/Funds

parameters.name: prefixTaxonomy
parameters.description: Filters by Google Content Categories. This field will filter by the category prefix only. Example: prefixTaxonomy=/Finance

title.example: NFT Market Hits Three-Year Low in Trading and Sales: Report

description.example: Annual NFT trading volumes fell by 19%, while sales counts dipped by 18% compared to 2023, according to DappRadar.

content.example:
The NFT market suffered a dismal 2024, with trading volumes and sales counts dropping to their weakest levels since 2020.

Annual trading volumes fell by 19%, while sales counts dipped by 18% compared to 2023, according to a report by blockchain analytics platform.

Despite a surge in crypto market activity, driven by Bitcoin’s all-time highs and booming DeFi growth, NFTs appeared to struggle under the weight of their own inflated valuations.

Early in the year, NFT trading volumes reached $5.3 billion in Q1, a modest 4% increase compared to the same period in 2023.

However, this momentum proved fleeting, as volumes plummeted to $1.5 billion in Q3 before recovering slightly to $2.6 billion in Q4.

Even with these fluctuations, annual sales counts fell sharply, pointing to a broader trend: while individual NFTs became more expensive in line with rising crypto token prices, overall market engagement dwindled.

Yuga Labs’ flagship collections Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC) and Mutant Ape Yacht Club (MAYC) hit historic lows, with floor prices dropping to 15 ETH and 2.4 ETH, respectively.

Even Otherdeeds for Yuga Labs' Otherside metaverse plummeted to 0.23 ETH, a far cry from their initial minting price, exposing cracks in Yuga’s high-priced, membership-driven model.

This coincided with DappRadar’s observation that “Perhaps 2024 helped us realize that NFTs don’t need to be expensive to prove their importance in the broader Web3 ecosystem,” a critique of the market’s reliance on exclusivity and inflated pricing.

Amid this downturn, the NFT market witnessed a paradox in November when CryptoPunk #8348, a rare seven-trait collectible from the NFT collection, was collateralized for a $2.75 million loan via the NFT lending platform GONDI.

Touted as a milestone for NFTs as financial assets, this event showed speculative excess when juxtaposed with DappRadar’s insights about affordability and utility.

While high-profile transactions like this aim to affirm NFTs’ value, they also highlight a market still driven by exclusivity and inflated pricing, even as wider participation wanes.

Even within the struggling sector, blue-chip collections like CryptoPunks defied trends, nearly doubling in USD value in 2024 with notable sales driving brief recovery periods.

NFT platforms like Blur dominated marketplace activity, leveraging zero-fee trading and aggressive airdrop campaigns to capture the largest share of trading volumes.

In contrast, rival marketplace OpenSea struggled with regulatory headwinds and declining market sentiment, forcing significant layoffs by year-end.

By Q4, Blur and OpenSea were neck-and-neck in market share, but Blur’s ability to generate high activity from a smaller, more active user base gave it the edge, as per the report.

While trading volumes in late 2024 hinted at a potential recovery—November sales hit $562 million, the highest since May—the overall trajectory suggests that affordability, accessibility, and utility will be critical for sustained growth in 2025.

summary.example: The National Finance Finance (NFT) market experienced a three-year low in 2024, with annual trading volumes and sales counts dropping to their lowest levels since 2020. The report by blockchain analytics platform DappRadar suggests that despite a surge in crypto market activity driven by Bitcoin's all-time highs and DeFi growth, NFTs struggled under the weight of their inflated valuations. Despite early Q1 trading volumes reaching $5.3 billion, a 4% increase compared to the same period in 2023, volumes dropped to $1.5 billion in Q3 before recovering to $2.6 billion by Q4. Despite these fluctuations, overall market engagement decreased. Despite this downturn, high-profile transactions like CryptoPunk #8348, a rare seven-trait collectible from the NFT collection, were seen as a milestone for NFT's value and highlighted a market still driven by exclusivity and inflated pricing.

Result.value: The request has bad formatting or missing parameters
No API key was provided in the request
Request was forbidden, likely due to plan restrictions or account status
The requested resource was not found
Some internal error has occurred, please contact support

code-samples.code:
import requests

API_KEY = "API_KEY"
url = f"https://api.goperigon.com/v1/all?category=Business&sourceGroup=top100&showReprints=false&apiKey={API_KEY}"

resp = requests.get(url)

print(resp.json())

require 'net/http'

api_key = "API_KEY"
url = URI.parse("https://api.goperigon.com/v1/all?category=Business&sourceGroup=top100&showReprints=false&apiKey=#{api_key}")
res = Net::HTTP.get(URI.parse(url.to_s))

puts res

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search story by name, summary and key points. Preference is given to the name field. Supports complex query syntax, same way as **q** parameter from **/all** endpoint.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Search story by name. Supports complex query syntax, same way as **q** parameter from **/all** endpoint.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: Filter by topics. Each topic is some kind of entity that the article is about. Examples of topics: Markets, Joe Biden, Green Energy, Climate Change, Cryptocurrency, etc. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. More ➜

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by categories. Categories are general themes that the article is about. Examples of categories: Tech, Politics, etc. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. Use 'none' to search uncategorized articles. More ➜

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: Filter to specific story. Passing a cluster ID will filter results to only the content found within the cluster. Multiple params could be passed.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filter stories by sources that wrote articles belonging to this story. At least 1 article is required for story to match. Multiple parameters could be passed.

parameters.name: sourceGroup
parameters.description: Filter stories by sources that wrote articles belonging to this story. Source groups are expanded into a list of sources. At least 1 article by the source is required for story to match. Multiple params could be passed.

parameters.name: personWikidataId
parameters.description: List of person Wikidata IDs for filtering. Filter is applied on topPeople field.

parameters.name: personName
parameters.description: List of people names. Filtering is applied on topPeople field.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: List of company IDs for filtering. Filtering is applied to topCompanies field.

parameters.name: companyName
parameters.description: List of company names for filtering. Filtering is applied on topCompanies field.

parameters.name: companyDomain
parameters.description: List of company domains for filtering. Filtering is applied on topCompanies field.

parameters.name: companySymbol
parameters.description: List of company tickers for filtering. Filtering is applied on topCompanies field.

parameters.name: nameExists
parameters.description: Returns stories with name assigned. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: 'from' filter, will search stories created after the specified date, the date could be passed as ISO or 'yyyy-mm-dd'. Add time in ISO format, ie. 2023-03-01T00:00:00

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: 'to' filter, will search stories created before the specified date, the date could be passed as ISO or 'yyyy-mm-dd'. Add time in ISO format, ie. 2023-03-01T23:59:59

parameters.name: initializedFrom
parameters.description: 'initializedFrom' filter, will search stories that became available after provided date

parameters.name: initializedTo
parameters.description: 'initializedTo' filter, will search stories that became available before provided date

parameters.name: updatedFrom
parameters.description: Will return stories with 'updatedAt' >= 'updatedFrom'.

parameters.name: updatedTo
parameters.description: Will return stories with 'updatedAt' <= 'updatedTo'.

parameters.name: minClusterSize
parameters.description: Filter by minimum cluster size. Minimum cluster size filter applies to number of **unique** articles.

parameters.name: maxClusterSize
parameters.description: Filter by maximum cluster size. Maximum cluster size filter applies to number of **unique** articles in the cluster.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter local news by state. Applies only to local news, when this param is passed non-local news will not be returned. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Filter local news by city. Applies only to local news, when this param is passed non-local news will not be returned. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations. More ➜

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: Filter local news by area. Applies only to local news, when this param is passed non-local news will not be returned. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page number. From 0 to 10000. See the Pagination section for limitations.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of stories results per page, from 0 to 100.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort stories by count, creation date, last updated date. By default is sorted by created at.

parameters.name: showNumResults
parameters.description: Show total number of results. By default set to false, will cap result count at 10000.

parameters.name: showDuplicates
parameters.description: Stories are deduplicated by default. If a story is deduplicated, all future articles are merged into the original story. *duplicateOf* field contains the original cluster Id. When *showDuplicates=true*, all stories are shown.

parameters.name: positiveSentimentFrom
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score greater than or equal to the specified value, indicating positive sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: positiveSentimentTo
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score less than or equal to the specified value, indicating positive sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: neutralSentimentFrom
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score greater than or equal to the specified value, indicating neutral sentiment. Explanation of sentimental values can be found in Docs under the Article Data section.

parameters.name: neutralSentimentTo
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score less than or equal to the specified value, indicating neutral sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: negativeSentimentFrom
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score greater than or equal to the specified value, indicating negative sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: negativeSentimentTo
parameters.description: Filters results with a sentiment score less than or equal to the specified value, indicating negative sentiment. See the Article Data section in Docs for an explanation of scores.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Country code to filter by country. If multiple parameters are passed, they will be applied as OR operations.

parameters.name: taxonomy
parameters.description: Filters by Google Content Categories. This field will accept 1 or more categories, must pass the full name of the category. Example: taxonomy=/Finance/Banking/Other, /Finance/Investing/Funds

parameters.name: topTaxonomies
parameters.description: Filters by Google Content Categories. Highlights the top 3 categories in a cluster, ordered by count.

message.example:
Errors during parameter validation: 
Error on parameter 'updatedFrom', invalid value 'test': Failed to convert property value of type 'java.lang.String' to required type 'java.time.OffsetDateTime' for property 'updatedFrom'; nested exception is org.springframework.core.convert.ConversionFailedException: Failed to convert from type [java.lang.String] to type [@com.gawq.api.formatting.DateTimeRequestParam java.time.OffsetDateTime] for value [test]; nested exception is java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Parse attempt failed for value [test]
